meanings.sent1: The toy car belongs to Tim.
meanings.sent2: The red ball belongs to Sarah.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy found a new home, belonging to a kind family.
meanings.sent4: Her heart belongs to the ocean, where she feels free.
meanings.sent5: The old book belongs to a forgotten era, filled with stories of the past.

meanings.definition: To be a member of a group or organization
meanings.sent1: I belong to the soccer team.
meanings.sent2: She belongs to the school choir.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat pretended to belong to the dog club.
meanings.sent4: His ideas belong to a different era, yet they still inspire.
meanings.sent5: The stars belong to the night sky, shining brightly above us.

meanings.definition: Something that is owned by someone
meanings.sent1: The shiny necklace was her most prized belonging.
meanings.sent2: His collection of stamps was a valuable belonging.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's dollhouse was her favorite belonging to play with.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact was a mysterious belonging of the museum.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was a cherished belonging, holding memories of the past.

meanings.definition: A sense of fitting in or being connected to a group or place
meanings.sent1: The warm welcome gave her a feeling of belonging.
meanings.sent2: Being with friends gave him a sense of belonging.
meanings.sent3: The quirky hat gave him a sense of belonging to the fun group.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song created a feeling of belonging to the moment.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cabin provided a sense of belonging in the peaceful forest.
